item.title: 众议院共和党通过权宜之计，让参议院民主党人在关门问题上望而生畏
item.description: 众议院共和党人通过立法，使美国政府在周六的关门截止日期后继续开放，参议院的温和民主党人敢于阻止这项措施，因为他们反对这项措施未能限制埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的削减成本运动。【原文：House Republicans passed legislation to keep the US government open past a Saturday shutdown deadline, daring moderate Democrats in the Senate to block the measure over objections it fails to constrain Elon Musk’s cost-cutting crusade.】

item.title: 达菲称 Verizon 在 FAA 升级方面行动不够迅速
item.description: 美国交通部长肖恩-达菲（Sean Duffy）表示，威瑞森通信公司（Verizon Communications Inc.【原文：Verizon Communications Inc. needs to pick up the pace on upgrades to the Federal Aviation Administration’s telecommunications network if it wants to hang on to its $2.4 billion contract, US Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy said.】

item.title: NB Renaissance 接近达成 CVC 支持的基因公司交易
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，NB Renaissance 公司已进入收购 Genetic SpA 公司的排他性谈判，该交易对这家意大利制药公司的估值约为 7 亿欧元（7.64 亿美元）。【原文：NB Renaissance has entered into exclusive talks to buy Genetic SpA in a deal valuing the Italian pharmaceutical company at about €700 million ($764 million), according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 中国在自己的后院向印度施压
item.description:
过去十年来，中国在印度洋建立了经济和军事联系。该地区拥有世界 40% 的近海石油和四个最重要的海上咽喉。【原文：

Over the past decade, China has built up economic and military ties across the Indian Ocean. The region holds 40% of the world's offshore oil and four of the most important maritime chokepoints.

】

item.title: 谷歌准备收购眼球追踪初创公司，为未来眼镜做准备
item.description: Alphabet Inc. 旗下的谷歌公司正在就收购眼球跟踪技术制造商 AdHawk Microsystems Inc.【原文：Alphabet Inc.’s Google is in final talks to acquire AdHawk Microsystems Inc., a maker of eye-tracking technology, part of a renewed push into headsets and smart glasses.】

item.title: 美国比特币储备系统究竟如何运作？
item.description: 通过 3 月 6 日的一项行政命令，唐纳德-特朗普总统建立了比特币战略储备，有效巩固了比特币作为主流金融工具的合法性。现在，这种世界上最大的加密货币将与黄金、石油和奶酪一样，成为美国政府的储备资产。【原文：With a March 6 executive order, President Donald Trump created a strategic Bitcoin reserve, effectively entrenching Bitcoin’s legitimacy as a mainstream financial instrument. Now the world’s biggest cryptocurrency will rank among the assets held in reserve by the US government, along with gold, oil and cheese.】

item.title: 加拿大养老金巨头聘请 Calpers 前首席信息官本-孟（Ben Meng）指导主动型投资
item.description: 加拿大养老金计划投资委员会（Canada Pension Plan Investment Board）任命富兰克林资源公司（Franklin Resources Inc.【原文：Canada Pension Plan Investment Board tapped Franklin Resources Inc. executive Ben Meng, former chief investment officer of a major US retirement system, to steer active strategies at Canada’s largest pension.】

item.title: 美国信贷市场对企业违约的担忧与日俱增
item.description: 周二，在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普威胁对加拿大加征关税后，美国对企业信贷违约的担忧连续第二天上升。【原文：Worries about corporate credit defaults rose in the US for a second straight day on Tuesday, after US President Donald Trump threatened to ratchet up tariffs on Canada.】

item.title: 美国证券交易委员会调查底特律郊区 3000 万美元债券销售网络攻击事件
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会正在调查底特律郊区的一项市政债券销售活动，该活动去年遭到网络犯罪分子的黑客攻击，导致约 3000 万美元的收益被盗。【原文：The US Securities and Exchange Commission is investigating a municipal-bond sale by a Detroit suburb that was hacked last year by cyber criminals, resulting in the theft of about $30 million of proceeds.】

item.title: 特朗普排除对澳大利亚征收钢铝关税的可能性
item.description: 尽管澳大利亚总理安东尼-阿尔巴尼塞（Anthony Albanese）的政府开展了游说活动，但澳大利亚仍未获得钢铝关税豁免，这对两国长期盟友之间的关系造成了打击。【原文：Australia won’t be granted an exemption from steel and aluminum tariffs despite a lobbying campaign by Prime Minister Anthony Albanese’s government, in a blow to relations between the two longtime allies.】

item.title: 衰退忧虑加剧，交易员加大对美联储降息的押注
item.description: 期货和期权市场上的交易商们纷纷押注，由于特朗普政府的激进政策议程，美联储今年的降息幅度将超过预期。【原文：Traders in the futures and options markets are loading up on bets the Federal Reserve will have to lower rates this year by more than expected because of the Trump administration’s aggressive policy agenda.】

item.title: 加拿大在美国出售债券，投资者摆脱贸易战影响
item.description: 周二，美国投资者摆脱了对贸易战加剧的担忧，以典型的估值从加拿大政府购买了价值 35 亿美元的债券。【原文：US investors shrugged off worries about an intensifying trade war and bought $3.5 billion worth of bonds from the Canadian government at typical valuations on Tuesday.】

item.title: 白宫表示 25% 的钢铁和铝关税将于午夜开始征收
item.description: "白宫发言人库什-德赛（Kush Desai）在一份声明中说："对加拿大和我们所有其他贸易伙伴征收 25% 的钢铝关税将于 3 月 12 日午夜生效，没有任何例外或豁免。【原文：“A 25 percent tariff on steel and aluminum with no exceptions or exemptions will go into effect for Canada and all of our other trading partners at midnight, March 12th,” White House Spokesman Kush Desai says in a statement.】

item.title: 特朗普再次冲击市场，华尔街陷入迷茫
item.description: 上午 10 点刚过，开盘半小时后，S&P 500 指数开始从周一席卷华尔街的恐慌性大跌中回稳。【原文：It was just after 10 a.m., a half hour after the opening bell, and the S&P 500 Index had started to steady from the fear-induced selloff that swept across Wall Street on Monday.】

item.title: 在特朗普对加拿大征收关税之际，美国铝溢价攀升至创纪录水平
item.description: 由于美国总统唐纳德-特朗普表示将对加拿大装运的轻质金属征收 50%的关税，运往美国市场的铝的地区溢价创下历史新高。【原文：The regional premium for aluminum delivered to the US market stood at a record high as US President Donald Trump said he’ll impose a 50% tariff on Canadian shipments of the lightweight metal.】

item.title: 优步终止收购外卖英雄台湾业务的交易
item.description: 优步科技公司（Uber Technologies Inc. ）终止了收购 Delivery Hero SE 在台湾的 Foodpanda 业务的交易，因为台湾的反垄断监管机构在 12 月拒绝了这一交易。【原文：Uber Technologies Inc. has terminated its deal to acquire Delivery Hero SE’s Foodpanda business in Taiwan, after the island’s antitrust regulator rejected it in December.】

item.title: 加拿大能源部长警告贸易争端将给双方带来痛苦
item.description: 加拿大能源部长表示，加拿大和美国之间针锋相对的关税将给双方带来痛苦，他敦促美国就贸易问题进行建设性对话。【原文：Tit-for-tat tariffs between Canada and the US will create pain on both sides, Canada’s Energy Minister said, urging the US to have a constructive dialogue on trade.】

item.title: 加密货币的新监管时代意味着 ETF 的新机遇
item.description: Cboe BZX交易所公司正在请求监管机构为一些基于以太币的交易所交易基金开放赌注，加入另一个平台的竞争，让投资者有可能通过持有的加密货币赚取被动收入。【原文：Cboe BZX Exchange Inc. is asking regulators to open the door for staking on a number of Ether-based exchange-traded funds, joining another platform in the race for investors to potentially earn passive income on their crypto holdings.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织支持向埃及提供 25 亿美元贷款和气候基金
item.description: 国际货币基金组织（International Monetary Fund）批准向埃及提供 25 亿美元的融资；其中约一半将立即支付；这对正在努力摆脱数十年来最严重经济危机的埃及来说是一个鼓舞。【原文：The International Monetary Fund approved $2.5 billion in financing for Egypt — about half of which will be paid out immediately — in a boost for the country seeking to emerge from its worst economic crisis in decades.】

item.title: 达美航空和 Airbnb 因消费者担忧领跌旅游股
item.description: 周二，达美航空公司（Delta Air Lines Inc.【原文：Travel stocks from airlines to cruise lines and online-booking sites are coming under pressure Tuesday after Delta Air Lines Inc. cut its profit forecast, deepening concern over weakening consumer demand and an economic slowdown.】

item.title: Prospect Medical 的宾夕法尼亚州医院面临关闭风险
item.description: 展望医疗控股公司（Prospect Medical Holdings Inc.【原文：Prospect Medical Holdings Inc. is looking to shutter several hospitals and outpatient facilities in Pennsylvania to stem its cash outflows, a move that employees said could “devastate” local residents.】

item.title: 稀土矿商称巴西融资稀缺阻碍行业发展
item.description: Meteoric Resources NL 发现很难为其价值 4.2 亿美元的巴西稀土项目在当地找到融资，这促使这家澳大利亚公司将寻找投资者的范围扩大到南美国家以外。【原文：Meteoric Resources NL is finding it difficult to find local financing for its $420 million rare earth project in Brazil, pushing the Australian firm to expand its search for investors beyond the South American nation.】

item.title: 加拿大卡尼将继续征收关税直至美国承诺自由贸易
item.description: 几天内将接替贾斯汀-特鲁多（Justin Trudeau）出任加拿大总理的马克-卡尼（Mark Carney）表示，加拿大将继续实施贸易报复，直到美国取消自己的关税并致力于自由贸易。【原文：Canada will keep its trade retaliation in place until the US lifts its own tariffs and commits to free trade, said Mark Carney, who will succeed Justin Trudeau as Canada’s prime minister within days.】

item.title: 股市动荡，美国重量级 IPO 计划也显得摇摆不定
item.description: 华尔街正在努力将一批备受期待的公司推向公开市场，但剧烈的波动和残酷的市场抛售有可能阻挡这些公司的发展道路。【原文：Wall Street is working to usher a highly-anticipated group of companies to the public markets, but rampant volatility and a brutal market selloff are threatening to block their path.】

item.title: 彪马警告关税和地缘政治紧张局势将打击 2025 年的销售额
item.description: Puma SE 预测，由于全球贸易关税、货币波动和地缘政治紧张局势，2025 年将再次出现缓慢增长。【原文：Puma SE forecast another slow year of growth in 2025 due to global trade tariffs, currency volatility and geopolitical tensions.】

item.title: 关税打击经济，加拿大央行将降息：决策指南
item.description: 加拿大央行可能在周三的会议上连续第七次降息，因为该国正在为贸易战做准备，除非迅速解决贸易战，否则经济将陷入衰退。【原文：The Bank of Canada is likely to cut interest rates for a seventh straight meeting on Wednesday as the country braces for a trade war that will plunge the economy into recession unless there’s a swift resolution.】

item.title: 凯茜-伍德的粉丝们不顾巨额亏损，向受挫的旗舰 ETF 基金投入 3 亿美元
item.description: 凯茜-伍德（Cathie Wood）的零售粉丝们正蹑手蹑脚地回到她的旗舰产品中，有可能结束长达 14 个月的流失。【原文：Cathie Wood’s retail fans are tiptoeing back into her flagship product, potentially putting an end to a 14-month exodus.】

item.title: 欧洲在动荡的特朗普时代寻求新的太空伙伴关系
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的领导下，欧洲大陆加强了防御，并面临着更加孤立主义的美国，因此欧洲与美国国家航空航天局（NASA）的对应机构正在寻求与一系列其他国家在太空领域建立新的合作伙伴关系。【原文：Europe’s counterpart to NASA is seeking new partnerships in space with a range of other countries as the continent bolsters its defenses and faces a more isolationist US under President Donald Trump.】

item.title: 增长担忧引发抛售，S&P 500 指数将进入调整期
item.description: 由于投资者对经济衰退的担忧与日俱增，他们纷纷抛售风险资产，转而寻求避风港，圣保罗 500 指数（S&P 500 Index）有望在周二收盘时出现调整，这是自 2023 年底以来的首次调整，此前该指数已从 2 月 19 日的高点下跌了 10%。【原文：The S&P 500 Index is on track to close in a correction on Tuesday, its first since late 2023, after dropping 10% from its Feb. 19 high as investors grow increasingly worried about an economic downturn and sell risky assets in favor of safe havens.】
